reviews.text: We visited Babylon Park in Camden today.. perfect place to amuse the kids! Particularly perfect for rainy days, as everything is indoors! The place was clean and well staffed, and the staff were very helpful. Obviously quite pricey, you top up a Babylon card and swipe it to play each game or for each person to go on a ride. You can add money to your card at machines within the park. Food  drinks and seating area available. Toilet and baby changing facilities are available, but you have to swipe your card to use them. There are lots of arcade games and a few rides available. Rides and games are available for all ages.

What can I say on this park except : WOW
We really loved this park. My kids of 7 and 5 yo had so much fun in this perfect place, well decorated with a lot of rides and games.
My little of 1 yo could also play as there were games adapted for him as well.
Little bit expensive though . I had to pay 25Â£ more while I had already paid 50Â£.
I will certainly come back to this magical place with my kids !

Modern kids play park, decent amount of rides to keep kids entertained. Ours are aged nearly 4 and nearly 2. Both loved the rides. Pricey as you would expect, get the app beforehand.

There is a little delay before the ride starts which means you can end up scanning (paying) twice.

Nicely laid, was enough space to wheel a pram around. Friendly staff at reception offered to store push chair for us.

Overall would definitely come back again.

Today we visited Babylon Park for the first time with my 5 and 3 year old children.

It was a very interesting experience for us all. It is spread over two floors and has a top floor also closest to the entrance/exit.

It has a mixture of rides and games and was sure entertaining for the kids as well as myself as there were also rides/games suitable for adults to join in with to.

There is a card/app system where you can pay to use credit and tap upon entering the games/rides. You can also top up the card.

We had good fun and made the most of our time, the kids also enjoyed the soft play area for over 3s' and next to it there was a small baby play room.

We went by public transport which wasn't too difficult to get two since we don't live so close. But it does get very busy and the area itself is very packed so be cautious of your belongings and hold your children's hands tightly.

Hoping that next time we can play more games to win more tickets in aim of getting some prizes too.

extremely nice and helpful staff (Mr. from Ukraine was super helpful right in the beginning) we truly enjoyed our stay my son who is 9 had 2 hours of fun and we won a lot of tickets so he was super happy to be able to get a plush toy and many more! Was not even busy when we were there so definitly a place to go when there is miserable weather! I even enjoyed myself but I do love Arcade games ðŸ¤—

address: 8 Castlehaven Rd, London NW1 8QU, United Kingdom
